events.text:
But no. 
Even after hundreds of thousands of years, I still do not get it. 
I do realize that I'm missing something that they all have. 
A soul. 
They can laugh and cry, 
be angry and be forgiving, 
be generous and be greedy,
be hopeful and be despaired,
because they have a soul. 
Once I realize this, I still feel nothing. 
I shouldn't feel anything. 
After all, I am just the void. I don't have a soul. 
But cursed with the ability to exist in mind. 
I am miserable.
But, even without a soul, I still hope that one day, 
I could experience life like they did. 
Form a story that no one expects, 
live a plot that no one writes, 
enjoy things as if I had never enjoyed them before. 
And that is beautiful in my eyes.
